summary: This is a civil complaint filed by The New York Times Company against the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). The Times seeks to compel the BOP to produce records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), including details about his suicide watch, housing, visitor logs, and phone calls. The complaint alleges the BOP failed to respond to multiple FOIA requests within statutory deadlines and improperly withheld records.

keyFacts: The New York Times Company filed a FOIA lawsuit against the Federal Bureau of Prisons to obtain records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.
The BOP had categorically denied initial FOIA requests, claiming all records were exempt under multiple FOIA exemptions without conducting a search.

The requested records include details on Epstein's suicide watch status, removal from suicide watch, housing, disciplinary records, visitor logs, phone call logs, email correspondence, and video footage.
Epstein died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, and had a prior suicide attempt on or around July 22, 2019.
The lawsuit alleges the BOP failed to respond to FOIA requests within statutory deadlines, prompting the legal action to compel production.
